intro: Viola odorata subsp. collina, commonly known as the alpine violet, is a perennial herb native to mountainous regions of Europe. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and cool, moist environments. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of violet or blue. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is often found in alpine meadows and forested areas. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been cultivated for its beauty and historical use in herbal medicine.
